conclusion: Determine the effective value of the induced electromotive force (EMF) in the coil using Faraday's law of induction.

The coil is a closed square metal coil with side-length L and N turns, rotating in a uniform magnetic field with induction intensity B, around an axis OO' perpendicular to the field and coplanar with the coil.
The area of the coil is A = L^2.
The induced EMF in a rotating coil in a magnetic field is given by the formula involving N, B, A, ω, and sin(θ).
The maximum induced EMF is calculated as E_max = N B L^2 ω.
The induced EMF is a sinusoidal function of time, and the effective value is the RMS value.
The effective value of the induced EMF is E_eff = (1/√2) N B L^2 ω.
The ab side of the coil is at a distance of L/4 from the axis.
The distance of the ab side from the axis affects the distribution of the induced EMF within the coil but not the overall effective EMF.
The effective value of the induced electromotive force in the coil is (1/√2) N B L^2 ω.
